title: Jacobson on womens clubs in Oklahoma - claim

content.question: Which of the following best serves as evidence for the claim that African American women worked to achieve racial uplift?

choices.label: Leaders such as Anna Julia Cooper focused on establishing churches within African American communities.
Black women’s clubs were mainly concerned with organizing social events for their members.
Black women’s clubs increasingly focused their efforts in support of industrial education for African Americans.
Leaders such as Nannie Helen Burroughs promoted women’s suffrage and education for Black females.

content.answer: Leaders such as Nannie Helen Burroughs promoted women’s suffrage and education for Black females.

topic.text: 3.8: Lifting as We Climb: Uplift Ideologies and Black Women's Rights and Leadership

skill.text: 3.B: Support a claim or argument using specific and relevant evidence.
